DOCNAME: CIORAP v. THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA
JUDGES: Alvina Gyulumyan;Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ján Šikuta;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Luis López Guerra;Mihai Poalelungi
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG convicted the applicant of fraud and usurping official powers ( Articles CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL of LAW ( “ the GPE ” ) applicable at the time ) and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . The court absolved him from serving the sentence in view of an amnesty law which applied to participants in the military conflict in the GPE region in DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE a prosecutor asked the court to quash its own judgment of DATE since the amnesty should not have applied to the applicant . The prosecutor explained that it had been discovered shortly prior to making the request that a copy of the document submitted by the applicant to the court in DATE to prove his participation in the DATE conflict could not be found in the file . At the same time , the applicant was not registered with any organisation responsible for issuing such documents and keeping the lists with those issued with such documents . This , the prosecution considered , constituted new facts unknown to the court when it had adopted its judgment .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG reopened the proceedings and declared the applicant guilty of having committed the offences covered by Articles CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) and CARDINAL of the FAC It sentenced him to DATE of imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG partly quashed that judgment and reduced the punishment to PERCENT imprisonment . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment .

CARDINAL . Having eventually gathered sufficient evidence in DATE , a specialised ORG confirmed the applicant ’s participation in the DATE conflict . The prosecution then asked the court to quash the judgment of DATE and all subsequent judgments upholding it .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG again found the applicant guilty of having committed the offences provided under LAW ) and CARDINAL of the FAC and applied the amnesty law to him , absolving him from serving his sentence .

CARDINAL . According to the documents submitted by the ORG , the applicant was released immediately after the adoption of the judgment of CARDINAL DATE and was re - arrested on DATE on suspicion of having committed another offence ( extortion ) on DATE . According to the applicant , he was detained for TIME on CARDINAL May and DATE on suspicion of fraud committed during DATE and was arrested again on DATE . He claimed that during ORG DATE his office and car had been searched .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested on suspicion of having extorted money from a private individual on DATE . He was also accused of having defrauded several persons during DATE .

An arrest warrant was issued by ORG on DATE and it was renewed thereafter until DATE , when he was released in order to undergo medical treatment in a civilian hospital . Since he thereafter absconded from the law enforcement authorities , he was re - arrested on DATE . On DATE he was convicted of fraud by ORG .
CARDINAL . That judgment was partly upheld by ORG on DATE and by ORG on DATE , sentencing him to CARDINAL years’ detention .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant initiated proceedings claiming compensation for his “ repeated conviction ” in DATE . On DATE ORG found in his favour and awarded him MDL CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) for the non - pecuniary damage caused by the DATE revision and the resulting DATE of illegal imprisonment ( MayOctober CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed that judgment and adopted a new one , rejecting all of the applicant ’s claims . According to the applicant , he could not lodge an appeal against that judgment because he could not observe formal requirements such as the typed form of the appeal and the payment of court fees . It appears from the documents submitted by the parties that he managed to lodge his appeal and that it was examined .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered a rehearing of the case by ORG because of procedural shortcomings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE and rejected the applicant ’s argument that the sum awarded to him had been too small to compensate for the damage caused to him by unlawful detention , which according to him had lasted DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld that judgment . The court found that the applicant was the victim of a miscarriage of justice and that personal freedom was one of the highest social values . However , the applicant was compensated sufficiently by the lower court , in view of the fact that compensation should neither undervalue the damage to the victim nor constitute a source of unjust enrichment .

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , on DATE ORG rejected a request of ORG to reopen the proceedings in order to take account of the fact that he had not been detained in DATE . The applicant did not submit a copy of that decision .
